title: Invalid address length, expected 40 got 4 bytes

body: FYI just downloaded 1.4.0 for Win64, and it also contains the bug, so the regression happened somewhere between 1.3.6-1.4.0.

As far as I know this was patched up last week (am I right, @bas-vk ?). One option would be to try the develop build and see if it's present still (in which case we'd need to fix it) or wait for today's release that should contain this fix too.

This is because geth 1.4.x does not allow the `from` address to be null, whereas geth 1.3.x it was allowed.  @knocte Nethereum has just been updated to not send the nulls which gets around this issue.  Update your Nethereum and problem should go away.
You're right, using Nethereum master and geth 1.4.5 works. Back in business :ok_hand: thanks

@knocte: Tried pulling in the web3 nuget package (Install-Package Nethereum.Web3 -Pre) and for ipc client (Install-Package Nethereum.JsonRpc.IpcClient -Pre) and the geth version is 1.4.7. But I am facing the same issue: expected 40 bytes and got 4 bytes. I am using .net framework 4.5.2 on Visual Studio 2015.
Suggestions?
